decks.notes: The main concept of the deck is to control the game by utilizing various counterspells such as Sinister Sabotage and Negate, along with removal spells like Heartless Act and Fatal Push. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Opt, Chemister's Insight, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Additionally, it has access to powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Shadows' Verdict. The mana base is designed to provide consistency and flexibility, with a mix of shock lands, check lands, and triomes to support the three-color combination of black, blue, and green.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells without tapping lands, allowing for a control-based strategy that utilizes cards like Gideon of the Trials, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By including Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck also gains additional card advantage and flexibility. The goal is to control the board with removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Supreme Verdict while setting up game-winning combos with cards like Transmogrify and Agent of Treachery.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from recurring cheap creatures. With a mix of creatures with prowess abilities and direct damage spells, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and finish the game before they can stabilize. The mana base is optimized for consistency in casting spells on curve, ensuring a swift and efficient aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this control deck is to establish control over the game by countering and removing opponent's threats while maintaining card advantage and flexibility through card draw and instant speed spells. This Sultai Control deck utilizes powerful spells like Shadows' Verdict and Shark Typhoon to control the board, while cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional value. The deck also includes cards like Wilderness Reclamation for mana acceleration and Thassa's Intervention for versatile control options. By combining removal, counterspells, and card advantage, this deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler while ramping up mana with Lotus Cobra and Omnath, Locus of Creation. Utilizing Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Escape to the Wilds, the deck aims to generate card advantage and maintain board presence. Genesis Ultimatum offers a powerful board presence swing, while Part the Waterveil provides extra turns for the player to solidify their advantage. By carefully managing resources and utilizing land ramp cards, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient control options.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal while ramping up mana to cast powerful spells and creatures, particularly Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck utilizes cards like Lotus Cobra and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to generate mana, while also including cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck aims to cast big spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to utilize powerful planeswalkers, disruptive spells, and removal cards to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With cards like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, the deck aims to generate card advantage while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Bloodchief's Thirst to deal with threats on the board. Thoughtseize provides hand disruption and Cling to Dust offers recursion and graveyard hate. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and winning through card advantage and efficient removal.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset, while also taking advantage of the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. The deck includes various board wipes like Deafening Clarion and Supreme Verdict to maintain control over the battlefield, as well as versatile threats like Fae of Wishes and Heart of Kiran. The mana base is designed to support the deck's two-color requirements, ensuring that the powerful spells can be cast reliably and efficiently.

This deck relies on using Niv-Mizzet Reborn as its centerpiece to control the game by tutoring for the right answers with cards like Bring to Light and Fae of Wishes. The deck has a versatile mana base to support its 5-color control strategy, with multicolor creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath providing additional value. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers and removal spells helps maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently through a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing low-cost spells and creatures with prowess abilities, the deck aims to deal damage rapidly and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional flexibility and card advantage in a matchup, creating added consistency to the aggressive strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain a fast-paced, relentless assault on the opponent.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field, then generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells using cards like Bala Ged Recovery and Hidden Strings. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces needed to generate an overwhelming advantage over the opponent by untapping Lotus Field multiple times in a single turn. The deck has a strong focus on card selection and manipulation to ensure the combo pieces come together quickly and efficiently for maximum impact.

The main focus of this deck is to use aggressive creatures combined with powerful Aura enchantments to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing low cost creatures like Alseid of Life's Bounty and Stonecoil Serpent, and enhancing them with Auras like Cartouche of Solidarity and Ethereal Armor, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and consistently. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to recast Auras from the graveyard. This strategy is supported by a mana base that gives the deck consistency and the ability to play its spells on curve.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards like Liliana, the Last Hope, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them in the long run. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and remove threats. It utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Grim Flayer and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck aims to grind out the opponent with card advantage and resilient threats while controlling the game through removal and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful creature with multiple auras attached to it, enabling it to deal massive damage to the opponent in a short amount of time. By utilizing creatures like Gladecover Scout and Sram, Senior Edificer alongside powerful auras like All That Glitters and Ethereal Armor, the deck aims to create a potent threat that can overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to stabilize. Season of Growth and Sentinel's Eyes provide card advantage and protection, making it difficult for opponents to deal with the aggressive assault.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a powerful creature by stacking auras on it. The key strategy is to play low-cost creatures that benefit from having auras attached to them, while also having protection spells to keep them safe. By using a combination of auras that boost power and toughness, along with cards that provide additional abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a creature that becomes increasingly difficult to deal with as the game progresses.

This deck focuses on creatures gaining power and toughness through auras and enchantments, creating a fast and aggressive playstyle. The key strategy is to quickly build up individual creatures with auras like All That Glitters and Ethereal Armor, while protecting them with cards like Alseid of Life's Bounty. By using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, players can continuously return auras from the graveyard to the battlefield, ensuring a steady flow of enhancements to overwhelm opponents. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful, buffed-up creatures early on.
